instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.P3V3SUS_EN: What is P3V3SUS_EN? P3V3SUS_EN is a signal that turns on the PP3V3_SUS power rail when it is high. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high..
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PM_SLP_SUS_L:
What is PM_SLP_SUS_L? 
The "PM_SLP_SUS_L" signal in a MacBook is related to the power management of the device, specifically concerning the 'suspend to RAM' state or S3 state. It's an active-low signal that, when asserted (low voltage), indicates the system should enter or is in the S3 sleep state. .
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.R7121: What is R7121? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7122: What is R7122? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  (<SIGNAL>P3V3SUS_EN</SIGNAL>)   RABBIT HOLE TO HELL!!   Green light, 0.040 mA current draw.
threads.message:
OK. I have been to hell and back on this board! I know that I am kind of new at this but OMG this board is a bitch!
I did discover some water damage around <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> but this area has been worked twice now and my <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> rail is good.

MagSafe light good
PP3V3 S5 good

<SIGNAL>P3V3SUS_EN</SIGNAL> Bad
<SIGNAL>SYSCLK_CLK25M</SIGNAL> X1 & X2 missing ( Y1905 crystal is doing noting. Occasional weird pulse no sine wave )
<CHIP>U1900</CHIP> & Y1905 replaced. (because I am mentally lazy)

<CHIP>U1900</CHIP> VDD Good 3.3V
<CHIP>U1900</CHIP> <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> good 3.3V
<CHIP>U1900</CHIP> <SIGNAL>P3V3_S5RS3RS0_SYSCLKGEN</SIGNAL> good 3.3V
<CHIP>U1900</CHIP> <SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> output good 3.3V
<CHIP>U1900</CHIP> PP3V3 S5 rail input good 3.3V

<CHIP>U1900</CHIP> PP3V3 TBTLC missing Voltage is 0.45v I checked for shorts. I am not totally sure what the hell TBTLC means. I seems to be power for <CHIP>U2890</CHIP> and <CHIP>U2060</CHIP>
<CHIP>U1900</CHIP> PP1V2_CAM_XTALPCIEVDD missing. I don't care about a camera right?
<CHIP>U1900</CHIP> <SIGNAL>PCH_CLK32K_RTCX1</SIGNAL> missing. "as to be expected in this state"

I have checked all the local resistors
is it possible that my harvested crystal is also bad? I never see these fail unless dropped.

I just don't have enough experience in this area. Would appreciate guidance.
I have tried to find a data sheet on this chip without success.

I think I am in a rabbit hole and lost!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  (<SIGNAL>P3V3SUS_EN</SIGNAL>)   RABBIT HOLE TO HELL!!   Green light, 0.040 mA current draw.
threads.message:
<CHIP>U1900</CHIP> area looks good.
25MHz oscillation is NOT in S5 state.

<SIGNAL>P3V3SUS_EN</SIGNAL> comes from <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_SUS_L</SIGNAL>, do you get it?
You didn't post basic power on signals.
Don't forget to check RTC signals too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  (<SIGNAL>P3V3SUS_EN</SIGNAL>)   RABBIT HOLE TO HELL!!   Green light, 0.040 mA current draw.
threads.message:
I knew I was lost. Thanks!

What turns on Y1905 on <CHIP>U1900</CHIP>?
I totally get I was down a rabbit hole.

I pulled out the Thermal and did find a hot spot.
<CHIP>U1930</CHIP>. It was not making good voltage on the output. There was no sign of water. Checked for shorts found none. Replaced <CHIP>U1930</CHIP>. When chip was pulled there was no sign of water. Hot spot gone. Now the board is pulling 0.15A and still nothing.

but... If I quick bounce the MagSafe it will go into S0 and does power up all the way to a question mark on the screen.

Back to power rail checking.
Now 3V3 S5 at L7560 is 0.5v unless I quick bounce MagSafe. checking that now.

The problem with the 3V3 S5 and having to bounce the MagSafe was <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> not coming up to proper voltage.  Each time you quick bounced it would rise a little then slowly fall. Traced that back to <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> <RESISTOR>R7121</RESISTOR> & <RESISTOR>R7122</RESISTOR>.  

I now have a working board!!!!!!
Thanks for getting me out of my hole.   

I am still am curious about Y1905  powering on.   I just cant find a data sheet on <CHIP>U1900</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  (<SIGNAL>P3V3SUS_EN</SIGNAL>)   RABBIT HOLE TO HELL!!   Green light, 0.040 mA current draw.
threads.message:
RTC 32KHz signal is square wave generated by <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> in base of internal RC oscilator.
<SIGNAL>25M_A</SIGNAL>/B/C 25MHz outputs are independently enabled, sine wave oscillation.
<SIGNAL>25M_A</SIGNAL> not used, as PCH has its crystal Y1915.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  (<SIGNAL>P3V3SUS_EN</SIGNAL>)   RABBIT HOLE TO HELL!!   Green light, 0.040 mA current draw.
threads.message: Just curious..  How are <SIGNAL>25M_A</SIGNAL>/B/C 25MHz outputs enabled?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  (<SIGNAL>P3V3SUS_EN</SIGNAL>)   RABBIT HOLE TO HELL!!   Green light, 0.040 mA current draw.
threads.message: Each one has an input on left side of <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> (VIOE)...
